ch.hslu.livingWithLightColors.BusinessLogic

Class LightColorsServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.hslu.livingWithLightColors.BusinessLogic.LightColorsServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILightColorsServer, ILogListener

    public class LightColorsServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements ILightColorsServer, ILogListener
    The LightColorsServer is the central steering part of the application. It controls the LogReader for command listening and the CommandExecutor for executing them. Beside that, it opens and closes the connection to the bridge.
    Author:
    Stefan

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Description copied from interface: ILightColorsServer
        Runs the server application. Should only be called once directly after starting the program. Prepares the BridgeConnection, starts the LogReader and the CommandExecutor.
        Specified by:
        run in interface ILightColorsServer

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from interface: ILightColorsServer
        Stops the server application. Should only be called before terminating the program.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface ILightColorsServer
